title: How to remove paragraph marks in Word for Mac - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on what you mean by remove. Those paragraph marks (their proper name is a pilcrow) play an important role in Word. Most of them store all the formatting information for the paragraph they’re in. I say most because that very first paragraph mark that is always there when you create a new document stores all the page setup information as well: size, orientation, margins, and so on. It also contains a section break. As such, it’s very important in Word. So, if by remove you mean delete them, then you have to delete everything in the document. But, of course, you can’t delete that last one. That’s always there. If you mean hide them from view, then simply turn off the Show/Hide Characters:  (Image from: Word for Mac: Viewing Nonprinting Characters - The Mac Observer)

Nevermind these are never printed (as far as I know) the option is/was in the Edit or View menus. It used to be Show/Hide ¶ but may be ‘Formatting’ or ‘Invisibles’. I’ve used Word v1,4,6,’98,’11 and not to mention scads of other text editors, but the point is they all have it. Word may have it in one of its ‘toolbar/ribbons/whatever-they-call-it-this-month.’
